spatial_accuracy.notes: Major layout divergence. The 2D plan’s left side is a single bedroom with two twin beds, but the 3D render shows two separate small bedrooms (extra partition), changing room placement and circulation (E5/E2). The 2D plan has a clearly enclosed living room zone at the bottom-middle with a defining interior wall; the 3D render presents a more open living/dining arrangement and the interior wall geometry does not match (E2). Bathroom geometry and fixture placement differ: 2D shows a shower stall, toilet, and sink arrangement; 3D shows a bathtub-like fixture and altered layout (E1/E2). Several doors do not align with the 2D positions/swing orientations, especially around the central hall and bedroom entries (E2/E3). Windows are placed/counts/sizes differ substantially; 3D adds multiple large windows not reflected in 2D and misses the small/narrow openings shown in 2D (E2/E5). Room proportions (hall width and room sizes) appear distorted relative to the plan (E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Adjacency relationships are partially preserved (kitchen/dining near bottom-right, right bedroom generally on right), but the left-side partitioning creates an additional room not present in the 2D plan (E5) and alters adjacency/circulation (E2). At least one required space is effectively missing in its intended form: the two-twin-bed bedroom is not represented as a single room (E1). Bathroom elements are substituted (shower->tub) (E1). Door embedding is inconsistent with the plan (multiple interior doors shifted) (E2/E3). Wall thickness is visually consistent within the render, but does not compensate for incorrect wall placement.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture does not match the 2D layout: the two single beds in one room become separate rooms with different furniture arrangements (E2/E5). Living room furniture placement differs from the enclosed living room shown in 2D (E2). Bathroom fixtures are mismapped (E1/E2). Scales are plausible in isolation but inconsistent with the 2D-defined room sizes due to proportion/layout changes (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric camera is correct and readable (good cutaway). Lighting is clean and consistent; geometry is generally crisp with minimal artifacts. However, it is not orthographic/plan-faithful (noticeable perspective/isometric stylization is fine, but fidelity to the floor plan is low). Composition is clear, but the incorrect structural layout reduces functional clarity relative to the source plan.

detected_errors.description: Hallucinated extra bedroom/partition on the left/top-left: 2D shows one bedroom with two twin beds, 3D shows two separate single-bed rooms.
Missing intended two-twin-bed bedroom as a single room (replaced by two rooms).
Living room enclosure/partition wall does not match: 2D shows a more defined enclosed living area; 3D presents a different open/shifted interior wall arrangement.
Bathroom shower stall from 2D plan is missing; 3D substitutes a bathtub-like fixture.
Bathroom fixture placement/layout differs from 2D (toilet/sink/shower positions not preserved).
Multiple interior doors are misplaced relative to the 2D plan (notably around the central hall and bedroom entries).
Door swing/orientation inconsistencies vs the 2D plan (hinge/swing direction not preserved in several locations).
Window placement/count/size does not match: 3D adds large windows and omits/changes the small/narrow windows indicated on the 2D exterior walls.
Room proportions and circulation widths (hall and room sizes) appear distorted compared to the 2D plan due to altered partitions and wall alignment.
